thread.title: Reliance Jio continues on the growth path, to reportedly offer 6-series mobile numbers soon
thread.title_full: Reliance Jio continues on the growth path, to reportedly offer 6-series mobile numbers soon

title: Reliance Jio continues on the growth path, to reportedly offer 6-series mobile numbers soon
text:
Reliance Jio continues on the growth path, to reportedly offer 6-series mobile... Reliance Jio continues on the growth path, to reportedly offer 6-series mobile numbers soon   “Currently, all mobile numbers start with 7, 8 or 9, and the series will be exhausting soon” 
It appears that Reliance Jio is all set to offer new mobile numbers beginning with “6”. According to Telecom Talk , the DoT (Department of Telecommunication) has allotted Reliance Jio 60010-60019 MSC codes in Rajasthan, 60020-60029 in Assam and 60030-60039 in Tamil Nadu. The company has also received 9-series MSC codes in Madhya Pradesh and Gujarat, and 8-series MSC codes in Kolkata and Maharashtra. 
As per the report, the Indian telecom subscriber base crossed 1.12 billion in November 2016 with 21.02 million new additions. The growth was led by the newcomer Reliance Jio, which now has more than 80 million subscribers in the country, and is expected to reach the 100 million milestone by this fiscal end. 
Currently, all mobile numbers start with 7, 8 and 9, and the series is said to be exhausting soon thanks to the rapid growth in the number of mobile subscribers in India.
